website_summaries.verdict: Once you find the right size, chances are you'll find that these fleece-lined compression pants are a welcomed addition to your outdoor gear.
pros: A good pick for men who spend a lot of time outdoors in the cold, as they are constructed of thermal material with fleece lining
Fabric also provides a comfortable, flexible fit and dries quickly when wet
cons: Sizes run quite small, so you may have to choose a size or two larger than you normally wear
Waistband tends to fit low on some men

customer_reviews.title: comfortable pants. Will update when I've worn them in ...
customer_reviews.text: Not too tight, comfortable pants. Will update when I've worn them in extreme temperatures. Update Nov. 17: I've tried them out in ~40 degree F weather under jeans and while my legs still felt cold, it wasn't unbearably so. They fit nicely and don't ride up under clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Quality at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by this base layer. Bought it in a pinch for a hunting trip. Did not expect much based on the low price, but when I put them on that first cold morning I was absolutly blown away by the quality and feel. Hands down the best underlayer I have ever worn. No binding, bunching or stretching out. They have the smooth polyester exterior with a velvity brushed interior that was perfect for all day wear in temps that ranged from 30-70' Stayed warm when needed and dry as things warmed up. If you are paying high $ for brand name gear...STOP...and give these a try. You will be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm during 30F Marathon
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run the Houston marathon. For folks in Texas, anything below 45 is COLD and with starting temperature reaching 30, decided to purchase thermals. Noticed how light they were, it's not true compression, meaning it's not tight but does offer good thermal baselayer. I didn't need to wear anything over it, besides light running shorts, more for modesty, than necessity. Definitely recommended and is good value.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, warmer.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of legs base layer. I love them. I just did 25 miles of backpacking in four days, hiking temps around 30F. I couldn’t wear these with my insulated pants, it was way too warm even with my torso stripped down to a couple thin shirts. 25F at night in a 45F sleeping bag, and these kept my legs warm. The large size fits perfect. I’m 5 ft 11, 185 lbs, wearing a 33/33 pants usually. My only gripe is that they did add quite a bit of hiking resistance. I was noticeably faster hiking without them. A touch more fabric might help, but then maybe they wouldn’t be snug enough to be an effective base.
customer_reviews.author: BigDog

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you order the right size, or they’ll charge you 5.99
customer_reviews.text: I’m a medium on sweatpants, shorts, pijamas everything, got this on medium but they just wouldn’t go up, which is ok, i though I could just send them back and get a size bigger, well you have to pay 5.99 to do that, no free returns on clothes, if I was to pay for it myself usps would only charge me 2.99 or less this item is really small. Not happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: 1st impression.
customer_reviews.text: I tried them on right away, just really quick to test the fit. My 1st impression is that they are really soft on the inside, very comfortable on the skin. I could feel the warmth fairly quick, they should help retaining body heat and wicking moisture while skiing. The fit is "ok" ... I suppose I am fairly "lanky". I am 5' 9" and weight 145-150. I don't know if this qualifies as "compression" but it fits fairly snug and Im pretty positive It will get the job done. -Will post photos and updates after a few uses and washes.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of running tights/leggings. I was always skeptical of their benefits until now. These have just a little extra warmth which is what I was looking for to help get through the winter. I have worn them under shorts on slightly warmer days and under sweats on colder days. They do provide some extra insulation but the wind will blow through. I'm 6' 0" and 195 lbs. I bought the large and they are a bit snug but I think the XL might be a little loose.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Better alternatives... if you can wait
customer_reviews.text: For the money, there a better name brand alternatives available... when those brands are on sale. These were a bit thinner, less soft, less stretchy and just a little less refined than the name brand stuff out there. What I will give it is these give excellent compression throughout your calf and thigh if you get the right size for your body weight and size. If you need something now, these are always offered at a low price but for me, I’ll wait.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nooen

customer_reviews.title: Not warm in temps ranging in the teens Fahrenheit
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be nice and warm, but they send the cold right through to my legs. With temperatures in the teens Fahrenheit (10-18F), I wore jeans over these leggings and it felt like the leggings were conducting the cold from the jeans instead of insulating. They only seem to be warm when I'm not moving which is very strange. The moment I start moving, I can feel the chill come through. I'm not sure if these are supposed to be used for when you're doing some activity, but I feel as if I would be better off not wearing the leggings and only the jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.
customer_reviews.text: Decent base layer for the price. No where comparable to UnderAr. but again, at half the price. Garmet is very thin, not sure where the "fleece" lining is. Seems to wick away moister & breath well as expected from polyester. Keep in mind these run EXTREMELY SMALL and tight. I actually had to go with 2X over my normal size for a comfortable fit. Which is still skin tight but not binding or overly stretched. I did notice that after an initial wash and wear the garments picked up an unusual (mildew) oder, strange. I'll be keeping an eye on that.
customer_reviews.author: RJP

customer_reviews.title: Functionality is important and these fulfill their purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not these r every bit as good as Nike pro or Under Armour cold gear 1 for a fraction of the price. Dont believe it spend the $36 for a top and bottom n try it. That's still less than one or the other from top brands. It's well made, comfortable. Only lacking a name brand. If u want warm gear this is for you. If u want a tag with a name on it, well your a special person then. Functionality is important and these function for their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Best fit & Best winter gear price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the compression winter gear for my husband to use on our next ski trip in a few weeks. He has already tested it in our cold weather snap in low 30s this week. Definitely helps keep warm. Fits snug and better than other pricier brands we have tried thus far. These don't crawl like other base layers. He loves the fit, loves flat seams and super soft inside & out and already ordered a second.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Love em. They do run small
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Tesla Thermals. Love em. They do run small, so order a size up - There is nothing I wear an xtra large in except these - but once you get past that they are awesome. Have had the last pair for about two years and they are still running strong. I wear them every weekend skiing (and the occasional run, but not too much because running sucks) & thought I should grab a second set because I hate whenever I get stuck wearing anything else. Snug but not too tight, thin but with nice comfy lining. These rule.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm, high quality
customer_reviews.text: Great compression pants for winter running. Used them today at 14°F for a 5 mile run (under thin running pants) and they kept me nice and warm. I purchased xl I'm 6 foot and 190 lbs. They are a little loose but nice that way my knees dont feel so constricted after running long distance. High quality and affordable. Love the olive color also. Nice and long length. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: i typically alternate between these, Underarmour, Dr.Skin and EU. obviously underarmour are better made and work better. Dr.Skin seems be more compressiony, theese seem to be better as far as thermals, the fleece lining is thicker so it keeps me alot warmer than Dr.Skin and is a great cheap options so im not spending so much on cold gear when the temps get lower. The thermals are definitely too warm when i work out so i prefer the Dr.SKin or EUs but for work and when i know im gunna beat them up these are a good buy just gotta figure your size out.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I used for a race in the Dallas area called Too Cold To Hold, so you can imagine how cold it was. It kept me warm and protected me for the coldness, I had to walk 3 miles from the parking to the race start, 1.5 hours of wait and then the whole race without problem, we were about 28 farenheit degrees if I recall properly. I used it for sleep when I traveled to Colorado as well, it makes a huge difference in Snowy weather.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Buy up in size but otherwise these are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my man but it was too small for him in LARGE so now I wear it! He is 6ft 180lb and these did not fit him even though he wears other LARGE sizes in baselayers. Because of that I am rating it only 4-stars as the size chart did not work for us. HOWEVER.... I LOVE these thermals! I am getting another pair for myself I am 5'6" tall 145 lbs and the LARGE fit me perfectly Warm, comfy, great material, well-made, thin enough under jeans, breathable...so many good things about them.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Mountain Farmer

customer_reviews.title: NO STRETCH AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I live in the cold hell known as Boston so I own 10+ pairs of thermal underwear, making me somewhat of an expert. These are horrible. Period. There's absolutely no spandex or other stretchy material that would allow you to actually put these on, and if you do get them on, they're extremely uncomfortable because there's no give in the fabric. At all. I actually threw them in the trash after trying them on they were so bad. I'd give them zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D.

customer_reviews.title: Warning, no slot for "relieving" yourself
customer_reviews.text: Second set of thermal pants in my life, just moved up north. Previous set from wally world had a little flap/slot arrangement like normal boxers/briefs. These have nothing, and you have to awkwardly pull open your belt/pants/base layer to use the restroom. Highly inconvenient
customer_reviews.author: M. T. Dewe

customer_reviews.title: No flap for when I gotta go, smoooth legs now
customer_reviews.text: Wore them once, after the first cup of coffee it dawned on me that I wasn't going to use the restroom outdoors very easily. They kept me warm but not for me. Sizing X-large, 6' 1" 192 they fit great, tight at the ankle. Last but not least...I now have baby smooth front thighs. They removed the hair off my legs better than any razor could and it did it in a 10 hour work day, and I mean smooth!!
customer_reviews.author: Monster

customer_reviews.title: Leggings Are Alright, But Size is Iffy and They Can't be Returned
customer_reviews.text: These leggings are alright for a base layer, but buyer beware, there's no return policy for them. I bought three pair hoping to try on different sizes, only to realize that I couldn't return the items I didn't want. Pros: Alright fleece insides Thin, work well as a baselayer Cons: No retuns Sizes can be iffy. Probably order your size or a size smaller. These leggings are THIN, which isnt helped by the fact that they're white. Anything below them can be seen easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This has been excellent so far down to in the 20 degree range and I'm taking into account me cycling at 15-20MPH so think adding in that windchill. The fitment is great. It's a bit tight but that's what you want for biking. It stays in place good not shifting all over when riding and it provides a lot of warmth while still wicking away sweat. I'm very pleased with this purchase. I have the matching shirt too from the same vendor.
customer_reviews.author: grm816

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm for winter runners.
customer_reviews.text: If you run 5ks in the winter or run outside in the winter like I do and hate the treadmill. Then you need to invest in a pair of these. I ran the toughest 5k in the State of Georgia this year. Brasstown Bald the tallest mountain in the State of GA this past winter. It was cold 17 degrees windy and rainy. Tesla kept me dry and warm. They are a must buy for all winter runners.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I find the reviews for this product totally misleading. This product will not keep you warm. It has no insulation and hardly any fleece lining. I regret having purchased it and don't recommend it to any one looking for warm thermal underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Camou Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Very tight
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 foot even, about 175 pounds. I ordered a medium, which I think is the size intended for my body, as the fit looks much like the models. But wow are they tight. My wife asked why I was wearing yoga pants. However, they are warm and I always wear something on top of them, so life is good. Because they are so tight they don't move around under my outer layer clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very poor compression
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better based on the price, but figured they would be comparable to my Nike leggings. They're cheap garbage though. The listing shows the micro fleece interior, but what I got was nothing like what they picture. Basically has no fleece at all. Compared to my Nikes, they stretch way too much and are just relatively loose and non-compressing. Really crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these over 1 year ago. I wear them at home when it's cold, and also sometimes when I bike to work if it's very cold outside. They are still in new condition. They are high quality and seem like they will last a long time. I used recommendations from other people's reviews and the item description to choose my size, and they fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Large, which is my size for everything else, including both the Nike Pro Combat and Reebok compression gear I already own. It was way too small and proceeded to tear the first time I tried it on. I am not a large man. I stand 5'11'' and weigh 175 lbs. I am not even going to waste the time or energy on returning these. Do yourself a favor and order the Nike Pro Combat.
customer_reviews.author: DPov

customer_reviews.title: Is there not thermal base layer pants. But just like any other yoga pants.
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered large. I just have a sense that these are too small. I wear medium underwear so I thought maybe it would be okay for these but I don't think I was correct also it says in the description that these pants are thermal protection. That's a whole load of BS. They are just like any other yoga pants. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Antibabylon

customer_reviews.title: Size must be off.
customer_reviews.text: Quality of material is good, as always with Tesla. Price is good, as always with Tesla. The reason why I am giving this product 3 stars is because the size can't be right. I ordered a large, as I always do when I order from Tesla. Ive ordered other base layers, briefs(I'm a landscaper and the briefs save me during the summer. I swear by them), and socks. I even checked the size chart from their website because Ive gone down in weight and size. So, its strange that these didn't fit. If it fit like all other large Tesla products I ordered, then I would be given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Too tight and doesn’t feel like Thermal.
customer_reviews.text: for the price tag, I expected much better. The size is too small/tight. I wore it twice but don’t really feel “heat” in the cold... it’s more like the tightness of the pants just keeps u warm. It is comfortable but again, expected better product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashraf M.

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking but these run way small...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in a large and I can’t even put them on they’re so small. I’m a 6 ‘ tall man, 185 lbs. and should have gotten the XL or even XXL, rather than the normal large which I usually get.
customer_reviews.author: Satchitananda

customer_reviews.title: Suprizingly Comforatable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a base layer for my waders. I wore these under flannel lined pants under waders and they were comfortable and kept me dry. Im a big guy (at the time I wore them a few weeks ago I was 320 lbs at 6 foot 2) and they fit very comfortably. Plenty of room for "the boys". I will state I do carry my weight in my stomach so my legs and thighs are not very big like most heavier set guys. I mention that so you can make a better determination on your specific comfort level. My wife liked em too! :)
customer_reviews.author: G1yp4.1337

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected & Stylish
customer_reviews.text: The Men's Thermal Compression Pants are nice- both aesthetically and functionally. Pros: Lightweight. Sweat wicking. Fabric strength is firm and not coming undone. Cons: Runs a little tight (suggested to go one size up. Currently using "S" - user is below 110 lbs.)
customer_reviews.author: All Might

customer_reviews.title: Makes you coldgear...
customer_reviews.text: These are similar to UA heatgear and don't help keep you warm at all, if anything I felt cooler while wearing these under my clothes. The description states it has a fleece lining which they don't have, it's just thin polyester.
customer_reviews.author: JoE

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable, but color washes out
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for trail running in the winter and they are absolutely perfect for that. They are warm, durable, and comfortable. The only downside is that the color washes out. I've washed them by hand after each run, and the water turns gray. The leggings are now a little lighter in color, but I'm OK with that. Just be warned. Don't wash them with other clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Teal

customer_reviews.title: Get a size up.
customer_reviews.text: When I first took these out of the bag, I thought they where children's baselayer pants, not men's. Bought the medium because that's the size I wear with the North Face baselayers and the TESLA shirts. They do stretch well and fit but the crotch area is too small unless you go a size up. Material is the same as the thermal tops which I love.
customer_reviews.author: S.768

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit, Okay Warmth
customer_reviews.text: I'm very skinny, so these actually fit me perfectly. I bought a pair of smalls, and I'm 5'9" and 125lbs. They're a bit tight, but I prefer my compression and thermal clothing to be snug than loose. It makes exercising/lifting/playing sports more difficult if they move around too much. In terms of warmth, they're not as good as I expected. The thermal long sleeve that goes along with this is much better. Even with these on, I still feel cold in a cold room or in cold weather. But it does provide some warmth, as sitting in the same cold room without them is worse.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout Leggings!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 13yo son to wear during baseball winter workouts. He loves them and says they provide a good deal of extra warmth, but not so much he overheats. We've had practices in the 40's and they seem perfect for that temp range and up. Any colder we go indoors to workout, so I can't comment on how well they do in colder temps. Very comfortable with a good compression fit. He's 5'8", 125 lbs and the medium fits him nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Fichte

customer_reviews.title: Check the stitching
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfy pants and have a lot of stretch. The material is very thin, much thinner than UA Coldgear, but it is very warm even sitting around. I ended up returning the first pair because the stitching around the waistband came loose in a few spots after one wash/wear. The second pair has better stitching.
customer_reviews.author: J t

customer_reviews.title: Lack of LARGE men reviews
customer_reviews.text: EDIT- update, dropped 2 sizes to XL calves fot well but feel like everything else is still too loose , my wife disagrees but being theyre compression pants they should be tight and compress.. 6' 1" 320lb.. pant size 42-44 XXXL is maybe a bit too loose for something that should be very form fitting. This causes the inner thigh crotch area to be neither snug enough or loose enough. Haven't tested warmth yet but an extra layer is an extra layer so theres that
customer_reviews.author: cccplaw

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Wow, exceeded my expectations as a runner. I've used many compression pants and but this was really good surprise. Fits well, holds onto the body keeping it warm and much better on price. I ran in 28F and absolutely fantastic, never felt that freeze. Appears to be very good quality. I will update my review after few months to talk about durability but I think this will hold good for long time.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: My wife got me a pair of these last year for Christmas. They've easily become my favorite pair of running tights. So much so that I felt compelled to purchase a two-pack. You should be enough to keep me warm through the Michigan winter running outside. In fact they're so comfortable I've been known to put them on "planning for a run" early in the morning and lounge around all saturday in them. Is that weird? My wife says that's weird.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Schaaf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit, feel and performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TSLA pants. I am 6'7", 250-pounds, avid biker (i.e. my thighs have girth) ... the US XL size fits great (not as long as I would like but that's not an issue, these aren't needed under my socks). Very easy to put on and take off, and they perform well. I wear these when biking (with summer shorts) when it is between 35-degF and the high 40's.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richard Behun

customer_reviews.title: Compression Thats Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Whit's father: I purchased these as a preferable replacement to the support stockings my doctor wanted me to wear to counteract the blood pooling in my lower extremities. I wasn't about to wear those old lady stockings! These work well enough and are still comfortable (I hate Under Armor, too darn restrictive/tight). I wear them all over my house and yard but not to town, no sir. And they fit well under my waders when I fish. I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: These are a must have for harsh winter's!
customer_reviews.text: I was originally worried that these would wear tight and would ride down my backside. I was surprised that these are the most comfortable pair of thermals I have ever worn. I would definitely recommend these for anyone that has to survive the harsh weather winter's. With a pair of pants and these thermal leggings, I couldn't be cozier in the -20 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: cole

customer_reviews.title: Fabric stretches, seams don't
customer_reviews.text: I have an earlier version of these pants by Tesla and I love them. The fabric does start to wear out where there is regular friction (inner thighs), but not unreasonably quickly. This new pair, however, has seams that do not stretch. I felt like my thighs were tied up in shoe laces. It was very uncomfortable. I returned and received a refund.
customer_reviews.author: C. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting warmer, certainly not as warm as a cotton thermal. Though they are comfortable and look pretty cool, I was generally disappointed due to them not being as warm as claimed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason.W

customer_reviews.title: Product not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give these a five star cause they actually are really nice and fit nice. But one big problem is it is advertised as having a micro fleece lining if you scroll through pictures of item there is a product description/specifications and on said picture it shows your pants to be micro fleece lining. Which is a big reason why I chose these pants. And what’s frustrating is it really doesn’t seem like a mix up or miscommunication it seems like you are trying to mislead your customers which is a shame cause you have a good product, and this problem doesn’t seem to be something I’ve only experienced as I’ve read other reviews claiming the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: ken mulligan

customer_reviews.title: The fit varies depending on the style.
customer_reviews.text: These are cut/seemed differently from previous styles which mean they fit differently not a big deal for me but might be an issue for those that far on the line of different sizes. As of this review there are three different styles here. I have them all and they are all a great product for the money but as should be expected all fit a little different.
customer_reviews.author: Nom DuPlum

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these tights
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these tights. They are snug enough to be like a second skin, just thick enough to give some protection but not too bulky to wear under jeans, don't stink when you wear them 4-5 days in a row and don't pull up at the cuff. Everything I want in a base layer. When you sweat into them they don't itch or rub and it can dry out a hard sweat in less than a minute. A pair of these and a pair of nylon convertible pants are my standard hiking outfit from around freezing all the way up into the 90s. I'm buying a second pair now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chubb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, but terrible sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the shirt that I bought from this company, these are awfully tight... even though they’re two sizes larger than all of my other clothes. Everything else that I own is size Large. So I bought these in size 2XL. And they’re still too small. Something is horribly wrong with this company’s sizing charts.
customer_reviews.author: Brian in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Size XL Review
customer_reviews.text: 6'2" 248, XL fit below my stomach comfortably down to my ankles. I have size 15 feet and the openings are fine. I have worn as underwear, tongue gym for Body Pump and on the ski slopes. Very comfortable. After 5 washes still are strong. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Riebe

customer_reviews.title: Good to have for winters!
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 176cms tall. My waist size is always changing between 34" to 36ish", so I ordered the Xtra-large size base layer pant and it fits comfortably well. The material is very thin and is very compact (as seen in the pictures) so it does not bulk up or cause discomfort when worn under jeans or even tighter forms or pants or trousers. It may not be very effective if the weather is super cold, but does a pretty good job of keeping you warm at temperatures up to -15 C or may be up to even -18 C (please convert that to Fahrenheit if you do not understand)
customer_reviews.author: Iconic

customer_reviews.title: Would have loved to give them a 5star but...
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are warm, have decent stretch, and the seams are solid. Downside: Way too small. Im 6'1 and 230, they fit my wife perfectly though. She's 5'6 and 180.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Keep warm when running
customer_reviews.text: These were bought for my husband to wear on cold running days. He absolutely loves them. They keep his legs warm and are super comfortable. He understands why I like leggings so much Ha! The compression is great in these too. Perfect to go under a pair of shorts for running or under pants when we go hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Wigley

customer_reviews.title: warm
customer_reviews.text: Spent the day in the snow at Lake Tahoe. Forecast said 28 degrees. Still had to layer up quite a bit, but definitely helped as I wasn't wearing any actual snow gear (No snow boots, pants, or even a winter jacket). I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: micah welker

customer_reviews.title: These run really tight!
customer_reviews.text: I received a shirt instead of pants on the first order. That was promptly corrected but still a bit of a hassle shipping it back for exchange. I wear a 32/32 relaxed jeans size but the large was too small. Thankfully my wife liked them so I'm going to order the x-large and see if they provide enough room for movement without showing plumber's crack!
customer_reviews.author: Ben & Sara

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy base layer
customer_reviews.text: These have worked well this ski season. Just wore this over underwear, then some gym shorts over these as a base layer under my ski pants. Legs got a little chilly on the lift during super cold days. Flexible, soft, warm, and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: very good for working out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these tights and use them for my workout at the gym.. now i am confined to the house because of the pandemic and i wear it with my biking shorts. They are comfortable to wear around the house on cool days . very comfortable and fit well
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Tesla Thermals Are Amazing. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Love these thermals! They are lightweight, movement is unrestricted, and above all, they keep you warm! Tried out the top and bottoms as a base layer Elk hunting in Eastern Nevada where it got minus 10F with a minus 30F on the windchill factor. Never once felt cold. I did have three outer layers, a pair of hunting pants on, but without the Tesla thermals I’m convinced I would have frozen my butt off! They are easy to clean too. Not to mention WAY more affordable than Under Armour thermals which now seem to dominate the market. Not for long...
customer_reviews.author: MIG720

customer_reviews.title: Great winter thermals
customer_reviews.text: Super great value for money. Branded fleece lined thermals like these would cost at least $60. With 4 males in the family, I was able to get 2 pairs each for our ski trip and saved a ton. My boys, (teenagers) were happy with the fit and warmth and did not complain when they switched from Nikes/Under Armours to these.
customer_reviews.author: DaniLena

customer_reviews.title: Cold Weather Running
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the need and exactly as described. These are exactly what I was looking for and you cannot beat the price. Nike and Under Armor are over priced for the same exact product. Definitely buying more on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Azzaro

customer_reviews.title: Soft and quality compression pants!
customer_reviews.text: Clutch in the cold! Def nice as an additional layer! Idk if you can wear these alone with some running shorts over the top in a cold environment. Highly recommend though. I got a XL; 6’ 195lbs athletic frame with a 34” waist. L wasn’t even close to fitting!
customer_reviews.author: JM7

customer_reviews.title: VERY comfortable to wear and keep you very warm
customer_reviews.text: these thermals are not your "regular" thermals. they are VERY comfortable to wear and keep you very warm. I can't believe these work so well at a fraction of the price that you would pay for "brands" like UnderAmour. Highly recommend these. they fit snug. I don't know if you'd get the same warmth if you bought them oversized?
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but not good cold protection.
customer_reviews.text: The pants are a snug fit; so very good for the circulation. But 70 degrees is my idea of warm; these pants FAIL their objective of protection from cold. I work graveyard shift. At 3am the temp hit somewhere around 32 degrees; I may as well have worn Bermuda shorts for all the "protection" they provided. Perhaps like most things, "cold" is a relative term. Those persons who start sweating bullets the moment the temperature hits 70 degrees may find these compression pants "toasty warm".
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but need to size up
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband to wear under his shorts when he rides his bike in the winter (he doesn't do bike shorts. Lol). The coldest he's ridden is 37° and he said they kept him warm. My husband generally wears a size medium, but we sized up based on previous post. The size Large fit him great and gave his legs great mobility.
customer_reviews.author: MommaMeli

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this company. Fits great. Feels great. Eill buy again when I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Keep my legs warm in the winter
customer_reviews.text: I wear these on runs when temperatures fall below freezing, but are still above 10 Fahrenheit. My runs are generally 8-12 miles. These can withstand the mileage and aren't too hot or too cold. They are fuzzy on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: ledi51

customer_reviews.title: Tesla Is The Best!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased A pair of the Capri compression pants for my husband (he loves to workout!) and he was so impressed by the quality that this is the only workout/compression line he buys now! It is a great price for such quality made pieces. It still looks great after several intense workouts and many many washes! True to size!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Good base layer
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the cold air off my legs and I wear padded cycling shorts over them. They dont bind in the knee or chafe at all so riding 25 miles is no big deal. Yes there are better cold weather options but the price isnt worth it for me when these work just fine. 40 inch waist and xxl fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing! I am a size 32-34 US waist, 200 lbs, I workout 6 days a week and sweat alot the Medium fit is true to size. These compression pants keep me warm and they are absolutely amazing to wear underneath your workout pants. fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and keeps you warm. Wore these in 35-45 degree weather while running and they kept me warm and kept my legs feeling loose. Only qualm is that they have a tendency to fall down your backside a bit while you’re moving. May make sense to go a size up
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Very thin so they fit under pants. Reasonably warm but not hot. The contrasting stripe color is very nice, but who really should be seeing your underwear? The only problem is a very thin waistband that tends to fold when working
customer_reviews.author: J B Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Wear these hunting as a base layer, -amazing warmth
customer_reviews.text: I wear these hunting as a base layer, have 3 pair of them, amazing warmth. I did not want to spend like 470 for UA. so I tried these and I was impressed. Fits tight but not to tight, Buy a larger size than you are. The only complant is that the company does not have all sizes and colors available -must be a seasonal thing... but I buy them when they post that they are in stock. If you find your size and color you want--buy them don't wait cause they sell out fast.
customer_reviews.author: RICK GUILLORY

customer_reviews.title: No warmth at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear under my thin nursing uniform pants for extra warmth on cold days but the product actually fell short and made my legs even colder when stepping outside. The product is well made and actually very sexy looking but just not what I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Tesla makes great fitness apparel! In the winter, I'll wear these under my shorts or sweatpants to stay warm. Also, the blue design is super cool, and these dry quickly. I'm content.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Smith

customer_reviews.title: Decent product overall
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a pair for a couple months now. Overall, they are really comfortable. On cold days (40F) I typically wear these under running shorts, and they keep me warm. The only gripe I have currently is that the threading is coming loose in a couple places.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ohhhhhhhhyeaaaaahhhhh!
customer_reviews.text: These things are sweet and bonus I feel like a pro wrestler in them. They have been doing the trick in this mild Virginia winter so far. Also they make me feel like a pro wrestler!
customer_reviews.author: Derek A. Weddle

customer_reviews.title: Warm and pretty!
customer_reviews.text: I moved to the midwest recently and so I’ve tried many of these. Usually its either warm and ugly or pretty and useless. This one is the only one that has managed to get a perfect score on both aesthetics and effectiveness. Very warm and it looks absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jude Ash

customer_reviews.title: Very good for mountain biking in colder weather.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'-1" and 215 lbs... XL fits good. These are not thick, but where I am there are days too cool for shorts, but not cold enough for long pants, so these are perfect. Also, I've had similar products that are more "slick" so knee pads slide down. This doesn't happen with these.
customer_reviews.author: lordst2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and two other Tesla leggings for my boyfriend to stay warm during Rugby season. He is 6'4 and heavy 280+. The 2xl fit fantastic and has stood up to multiple practices and games. He is a W38 L32 in his lucky brand athletic fit pants.
customer_reviews.author: xlbashfullx

customer_reviews.title: Feel Great, Terrific Value
customer_reviews.text: These are my first thermal leggings I've bought for running. I took them for a spin this morning for the first time, a 5-mile run in 26-deg weather. They were very comfortable and kept me warm but not too warm the whole way--exactly what I was looking for. So far they're a terrific value.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't warm it
customer_reviews.text: Well Didnt warn at all, I ride a bike here in ny it is 35 F and I'm freezing with this thermal pants, do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not for tall overweight guys
customer_reviews.text: They are great quality, and may fit you if you are overweight and short. Do not purchase if you are overweight and taller than 5' 6 or 5' 7" I am 6' 272lbs, and the legs fit ok, but I can't even get them up to my waist. Asian manufacturers really need to start separating their Western and Eastern product lines. Because it is tough deciding what will fit and what won't. i would need a 4XL to wear these. The Tesla Shirt equivalent fit proportionately decent though.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Sizes run small, but great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a large which is my normal size. Fits very tight. I'm 6' 2" and 195lbs. Would recommend one size up if you're built like myself. They are warm however, and plan on ordering one size up for work in winter.
customer_reviews.author: Stinkycableguy

customer_reviews.title: Size chart may be off
customer_reviews.text: These are warm but I'm not sure if I got the right size. I was a swimmer and my swimsuit was loser than these however I'm afraid if I get the bigger size it will be too big. I based my size decision on their size chart where it says to order a size smaller but not sure it's right.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W.

customer_reviews.title: I Love Them and they make me want to workout!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I never realized how great they are to have when working out in the less than perfect weather. I wear mine with underwear so I don't have to wash them as often and shorts over because it makes me comfortable (I see lots of people not wear shorts over and it is totally fine, do whatever floats your boat). I will be getting more pairs for sure! They are great!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not for hunting
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for hunting and expected them to be a little thicker. They are super thin with no front opening. I've only wore them once and it'll probably be the last. Buy a size bigger than normal cause they seem to run small.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Shockey

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews had me worried that these would be too shear or see through. They are not see through. I was also worried about size based on other reviews. I am 5' 10" tall, weigh 165lbs, have a 32" waist and a 32" inseam. They fit me great. They do conform to my body as they are supposed to, but they are not tight enough to constrain me, and are not so tight you can actually see through them. I wear them for cold weather running, sometimes as an undergarment, or sometimes as the only layer I have on.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great for snowboarding
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few pairs of these as a base layer. They do the trick, worn them in 0 degree weather, slushy wet snow, all the good stuff and they hold up fine. Keep me warm and dry. Quality is actually pretty good considering how inexpensive they are and the colors look good too. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: Tesla Thermal compression pants/tights-  great to wear underneath pants to keep you warm  outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: Tesla Thermal Wintergear compression is even better than other leading brands. It feels snug, soft, and keeps me warm. I use this a lot when I go hunting and generally when I stay outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Tycoon

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!!
customer_reviews.text: Took a trip to the mountains in cali for winter time and man I was impressed by these. They held up and wick moisture pretty good. Wore them while snowboarding and kept me warm but not overly warm where you would have to remove layers.
customer_reviews.author: The guy from that thing

customer_reviews.title: Runs small!
customer_reviews.text: The material was ok, but I had to return them because they run very small. I ordered a men's small for my 14 yo, he probably needs a medium at least.
customer_reviews.author: NYRock-a-way

customer_reviews.title: Held up perfect under extreme conditions
customer_reviews.text: I ran a difficult overnight 50 mile race in the December cold of Iowa with over 10,000 feet of climbing and even more descent and these compression base layer leggings held up perfectly. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Newland

customer_reviews.title: Article received had no tags & repackaged.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed to receive a returned product. Original tags were missing & repackaged in a bag identified as "Ready to ship." Although identified as "thermal" in description...hardly seems to be the case. Does appear to be a quality product but very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfy. Fuzzy inside lining is soft enough to keep you warm. They are nice snug fitting without the loose thick feeling of thermals. Thin enough they can be worn comfortably enough under a tight pair of pants when that little extra baselayer is just enough to keep you warm. Never thought I'd look this good in a pair of leggings. Now I know why women wear them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Malsack

customer_reviews.title: The XL fit me perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Im 6' tall 205lb 32/33 inch waist and I ordered the XL. They fit perfectly and the end of each leg almost covers my ankle. Will be buying more of them in different colors and patterns. Mine are the woodland camo finish, they look higher dollar thanthe 15$ they cost me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Warmer than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to tun small. Im 5'9" 140 lbs and the large are perfect. Medium were like capris on me. Other than that they are absolutely great for working in 30°f and below
customer_reviews.author: nclark513

customer_reviews.title: Great. Sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: Great for winter riding (bikes and motorcycles). Shame the next two I ordered I had to return due to being thinner with a whole lot more seams.
customer_reviews.author: Pacman

product_meta.title: TSLA 1 or 2 Pack Men's Thermal Compression Pants, Athletic Sports Leggings & Running Tights, Wintergear Base Layer Bottoms
feature_bullets: Winter gear : Thermal Pants designed for warmth (Fleece lining).
Materials : Mix of Polyester & Spandex. Excellent elasticity with enhanced range of motion.
Perfect option during various indoor activities and outdoor excursion.
Moisture Sensing/Quick time Dry/TWO-WAY Air Circulation.
Non abrasion fabric material with excellent elasticity and durability
